section.title: MySQL - Disable Command History
section.para:
Disables the MySQL command history by setting the MYSQL_HISTFILE environment variable to "" for all login sessions. MYSQL_HISTFILE
MySQL
SQL

By default, all commands run in the MySQL console application are saved to a history file. Disabling the MySQL command history reduces the probability of exposing sensitive information, such as passwords. console
password

tip.title: TIP: Enabling command history for certain accounts
tip.para: On a case-by-case basis, you could authorize certain database administrators to set the MYSQL_HISTFILE back to the default $HOME/.mysql_history file.
However, it is recommended that you erase the file when the session is complete. One way to do this is to add cat /dev/null > $HOME/.mysql_history to their $HOME/.bash_logout script.
